c

div.h2: WELCOME TO COLONIAL BEACH SCHOOL DISTRICT

span.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, Geneva, Swiss, SunSans-Regular;

div.span:
WELCOME-The Colonial Beach Public School System was established as an independent school division in 1907. It serves the residents of Colonial Beach, which is a small town of about 3,500 people located directly on the Potomac River. Our division has an elementary school for grades PK-7 and a high school for grades 8-12.Our small size provides a strong sense of community,with a totalstudent population of approximately 600 students.
Please browse through our website to learn more about ColonialBeach Schools. We are committed to excellence in every area of student endeavor.

span.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, Geneva, Swiss, SunSans-Regular;

div.span: The Colonial Beach School Board is committed to nondiscrimination with regard to sex, gender, race, color, national origin, disability, religion, ancestry, age, marital status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law. This commitment prevails in all of its policies and practices concerning staff, students, educational programs and services, and individuals and entities with whom the Board does business.
